  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNLOADER FOUND THE PACKAGE TO BE LEAKING IN A TRAILER. PROGRESS WAS STOPPED AND THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE INCIDENT. RESPONDER PLACED PACKAGE IN A SPILL TRAY AND MOVED IT TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA.

item.title: Report E-2025010030
item.description:
Report E-2025010030

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: STEWARTVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately twenty (20) ounces of material released from one (1) 3468-pound plastic tote due to a packaging failure that resulted in a release. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight deployed granular absorbents and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
